body_html:
The build isn't hermetic (its only supported purpose is building the PIP package on our CI server), so I believe MSBuild isn't able to detect opportunities for incremental building. If this is easy to fix, and somebody who knows how to do that is reading, we'd welcome contributions on that topic.

This suggests a possible cause for the error you are seeing: if your build directory contains some files created during a previous failed build, these could be causing the new build to fail. It might be easiest to try deleting the entire tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/ directory, then creating a new build from scratch.

The build isn't hermetic (its only supported purpose is building the PIP package on our CI server), so I believe MSBuild isn't able to detect opportunities for incremental building. If this is easy to fix, and somebody who knows how to do that is reading, we'd welcome contributions on that topic.
This suggests a possible cause for the error you are seeing: if your build directory contains some files created during a previous failed build, these could be causing the new build to fail. It might be easiest to try deleting the entire tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/ directory, then creating a new build from scratch.
body:
The build isn't hermetic (its only supported purpose is building the PIP package on our CI server), so I believe MSBuild isn't able to detect opportunities for incremental building. If this is easy to fix, and somebody who knows how to do that is reading, we'd welcome contributions on that topic.

This suggests a possible cause for the error you are seeing: if your build directory contains some files created during a previous failed build, these could be causing the new build to fail. It might be easiest to try deleting the entire `tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/` directory, then creating a new build from scratch.
